abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Trade Policy Loan Project is
            the second operation to support the Government's
            program for integrating Argentina into the world's
            economy. The loan will support a set of sector specific
            reforms to achieve the following objectives: (1) the removal
            of non-tariff barriers to imports; (2) the reduction and
            rationalization of tariff protection; (3) the limitation of
            safeguard measures and anti-dumping and anti-subsidy duties
            to the very short term; (4) the deregulation of industrial
            exports; and (5) the tightening of the existing industrial
            promotion regime. The loan will be used to finance 100 per
            cent of the cost of eligible imports. Also funded will be a
            technical assistance component designed to strengthen the
            Government's control of the industrial promotion regime.
